title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Massachusetts Eye and Ear Infirmary (Malden, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Great experience, done through zoom. All questions answered by interviewer. Some difficult questions, but thinking on my feet helped me to give a complete answer. I would recommend interviewing here.
Interview Questions: They asked about my experience and strategies for multitasking.

title: Janitor/Cleaner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Massachusetts Eye and Ear Infirmary (Boston, MA) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was very concise and overall a good experience. It did not take very long and it was easy to get there and back. The staff and the interviewer were all very nice.
Interview Questions: Tell me more about yourself

title: Marketing Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts Eye and Ear Infirmary
Interview Descriptions: Participated in five interviews, spoke with a total of 9 people over the course of 4-6 weeks. Heard nothing for another 4 weeks, until receiving an automated email on a Saturday morning. People I spoke with were somewhat distracted and also rescheduled several times.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years? And more generic questions.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Massachusetts Eye and Ear Infirmary (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: First interview was by telephone and then an in-person visit. I met with the team and toured the facility. Everyone asked questions and I got to too. Main interaction was with the senior postdoc and the PI.
Interview Questions: My research background, why I wanted to do research and time commitment.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts Eye and Ear Infirmary (Boston, MA) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: This entailed two days of being interviewed via Zoom and by phone call by members of the team and HR personnel. The staff was very friendly and somewhat managed to ease my anxiety in the interview. The questions were related to my previous work experiences and career goals.
Interview Questions: If they were to contact my previous employer, what would be said about me?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts Eye and Ear Infirmary
Interview Descriptions: I applied the position of research assistant which job responsibility is to perform certain experiments  in a large research team.  The team members asked general questions about my past research (behavior question). They were trying to see if you can well fit in the team or not.  Having an interview is a good chance to see if you want to join the team or not . To sum up, it is a great experience.
Interview Questions: What type of work are you looking for?

title: Medical Administrative Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts Eye and Ear Infirmary (Boston, MA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very easy interview!! Very friendly staff. I applied online and the director sent me an email in order to schedule an interview. Then I was for a second interview and after sending my references they sent me a job offer
Interview Questions: Your previous experience

title: Research Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts Eye and Ear Infirmary (Boston, MA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: You will get an interview offer from the lab supervisor who is usually a research fellow or a MD/PhD that you will work under if you get the job.
Interview Questions: your lab experiences and research understanding

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Massachusetts Eye and Ear Infirmary (Boston, MA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions:
very thorough questions and a telephone call with my previous boss to check my background
very thorough questions and a telephone call with my previous boss to check my background
very thorough questions and a telephone call with my previous boss to check my background
Interview Questions: PhD project, future career plan and specific questions about research

title: Registered Nurse Out-pt Pre/Post-Op Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Massachusetts Eye and Ear Infirmary (Boston, MA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was great. It was with the Manager and Assistant Manager then I was invited to interview with two staff members. All systems were a "go" and it would have been a perfect fit.But I NEVER heard back from anyone. I called to follow-up and spoke to the Asst. Manager who said I would here from the Manager. I never heard from her nor from HR. In the past couple of years I have interviewed with MEEI before. I have NEVER heard back from anyone although I am a nurse of 35 years have my BSN, speak Spanish, and have excellent clinical skills and background with certifications including ACLS, PALS, TNCC, and IV Therapy. It is their loss and they are very disappointing as a potential employer. Shame on you MEEI.
Interview Questions: Standard Questions pertaining to my 35 year nursing career.

title: Study Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts Eye and Ear Infirmary (Boston, MA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Relatively easy interview. Questions were to the point rather than asking me to give long answers. It was almost as if the interviewer was trying to sell me on the job position given my resume experience/educational background. We probably spoke more about the job and what they have done/what they want to do more than my prior experience.
Interview Questions: What type of work are you looking for?

title: Ophthalmic Photographer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts Eye and Ear Infirmary (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process I experienced with Mass. Eye & Ear was unprofessional in my opinion. I received an offer, which was revoked after I tried to negotiate higher pay. They redefined the scope of the position. The conclusion I draw from this experience is that there is poor communication between managers and human resources. Please reference "negotiation" section below for more details.
Interview Questions: Questions were typical in nature about past and current experience.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Massachusetts Eye and Ear Infirmary
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got an email suggesting I more than fit the role. I had an interview with my employer but it seemed like they already wanted to get me into the position! Barely asked me any difficult questions, it seemed they knew they wanted me. So they showed me around the facility. It was a good ole time =]
Interview Questions: Tell me about your past work history?

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts Eye and Ear Infirmary in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I received a call from a recruiter; I had an in-person interview with two would be supervisors; a recruiter requested references via email; I was offered and accepted the job
Interview Questions: How are you a good fit?

title: PATIENT STUDY COORDINATOR Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Massachusetts Eye and Ear Infirmary (Boston, MA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I received a call from the Manager asking me to discuss my previous employment, experience and interest in the position. Then we set up a time for me to come into the office. My interview was very disorganized. The manager seemed like they did not know what to ask or how to conduct an interview. It was in a messy office, very distracting and unclear.
Interview Questions: why are you interested in this position?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts Eye and Ear Infirmary (Boston, MA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Nurse manager was great very personable, she was specific with expectations and job description. Human Resources asked  scripted general questions; did not apply to position for which I was applying.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Research Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Massachusetts Eye and Ear Infirmary in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very Professional. Mostly about previous lab experience. The interview difficulty level was average. I applied online for the job application. The process was 2 step, phone screen followed by an in person interview.
Interview Questions: Past lab experience

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Massachusetts Eye and Ear Infirmary (Boston, MA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: When I arrived to the hospital, I got a little lost finding my way to where the interview was taking place. Everyone was eager to help me find my way. The hiring manager was kind and thorough. I was put at ease and was allowed to ask any questions. I was called and given an offer a few days later. I was allowed to think about it and called to accept it the next day
Interview Questions: What's your biggest weakness?

title: Cook Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Massachusetts Eye and Ear Infirmary (Boston, MA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Thorough and standard interview. Asked questions about past experience and where I plan on being in the future. Was interviewed by two managers, at first it was frightening, then becaume more relaxed. They were laid back but concise. Made the interview go quick and calm.
Interview Questions: What I can offer as a cook?

title: Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Massachusetts Eye and Ear Infirmary (Boston, MA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application (online), received phone call requesting interview, interview with Human Resources representative, interview with department manager
Interview Questions: Why do you think you belong with our company?

title: Registration Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Massachusetts Eye and Ear Infirmary in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Must have customer service and be able to communicate professionally with patients
Interview Questions: N/A
